CatDescriptText: B. Vann Johnson, state employee, Schenley Heights, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that men should marry women within their own age bracket (not over fiver years difference) or do you approve of 'May and December' marriages?" answer reads: "The age factor has been imposed by society as a barrier....It should be left to the individuals..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of B. Vann Johnson wearing short sleeve light colored button down collared shirt with eyeglass case in breast pocket and eyeglasses, standing in front of building with windows and ribbed metal wall
